interestingcomments.content: M5 quick menu /!/ Hello, I have a question on the M5. On my other canon DSLRs when I have the quick menu up (i think that is what it is called) I can still adjust the shutter and aperture and press the Q button when I want to adjust something else. On the M5 when this screen is up I can only adjust what the orange box is highlighted. I can’t figure out what to press to get rid of the orange box so I can just aperture and shutter without putting the camera or switching to live view. Is this how it is my design? Or is there a setting I am missing?  https://i.imgur.com/9XmLfoZ.jpg

interestingcomments.content: Pixma TS 9020 feed roller gear /!/ My Canon Pixma TS 9020 has lost its feed roller gear so it will not print. I understand that I could send it back and get a new one, but I figured I’d try to fix it myself first. I no longer have the gear, but do have access to a 3D printer. I was wondering if anyone had either a replica file or even just the dimensions so I could design it. Thanks :D
